title: Unix and Its Languages
description: One-minute skill: Unix and Its Languages.

hook.text: Ken Thompson wrote the first Unix kernel in just three weeks in the summer of 1969.

buildup.text: Unix was rebuilt in C, proving an OS could be written in a high-level language.

discovery.text: Unix introduced the shell â€” a command language that chained small programs into pipelines.

twist.text: AT&T gave Unix to universities for free. Students hacked it, improved it, and spread it.

climax.text: Linux, macOS, Android, and most servers today all descend from Unix's philosophy.

punchline.text: One summer project became the world's backbone.

quiz.question: How long did it take Ken Thompson to write the first Unix kernel?
